title: typed "..." parameter declaration gives syntax error
body:
by **eric.bergstrome**: 
Before filing a bug, please check whether it has been fixed since
the latest release: run "hg pull -u" and retry what you did to
reproduce the problem.  Thanks.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Save the attached file (test.go).
2. 6g test.go

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
Expecting program to compile silently.  Instead, I see this:
"test.go:3: syntax error: unexpected name, expecting )"

What is your $GOOS?  $GOARCH?
darwin amd64

Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)
0a2770db06ef tip

Please provide any additional information below.

The commented code in test.go shows an alternative way of saying what 
I'm trying to say.  By switching in the commented code, the file compiles 
and, when run, gives what I expect.
Attachments: 1. test.go (341 bytes)
